item.title: Here are the PC specs for Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
item.content:encoded:
PC players, get ready for your mind to be melted (metaphorically speaking) in all manner of ways. Hideo Kojima's ever so unusual Death Stranding sequel - known as On the Beach - is soon going to make its PC debut, and so of course the team has now shared those all important specs you will need to get the best experience.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

The PC specs for Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, ranging from Minimum to Very High, can be found via the table below:

Category Minimum Medium High (Recommended) Very High
Graphics Preset Low Medium High Very High
Avg Performance 1080p @ 30 FPS 1080p @ 60 FPS 1440p @ 60 FPS 4K @ 60 FPS
GPU NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1660AMD Radeon RX 5500 XT 8GB NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 12GBAMD Radeon RX 6600 NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070AMD Radeon RX 6800 NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4080AMD Radeon RX 9070 XT
CPU Intel Core i3-10100AMD Ryzen 3 3100 Intel Core i5-11400AMD Ryzen 5 5600 Intel Core i7-11700AMD Ryzen 7 5700X Intel Core i7-11700AMD Ryzen 7 5700X
RAM 16GB 16GB 16GB 16GB
OS Windows 10/11 (Version 1909 or newer) Windows 10/11 (Version 1909 or newer) Windows 10/11 (Version 1909 or newer) Windows 10/11 (Version 1909 or newer)
Storage 150GB SSD 150GB SSD 150GB SSD 150GB SSD

And, here is all of that information again, but this time in a lovely infographic:

Death Stranding 2: On the Beach will arrive on PC next month, on 19th March. For those keeping track, that is less than a year since Death Stranding 2 made its bombastic debut in June of last year on PS5.

So, will you be picking it up on PC? If you are still on the fence about whether or not Death Stranding 2: On the Beach is for you, be sure to check out our PS5 thoughts. "A busier, louder, and more emotionally resplendent take on this singular hiking sim," reads Eurogamer's four star review by Lewis Gordon.

Elsewhere in the world of porters, last year Kojima Productions announced its Death Stranding anime series will be heading exclusively to Disney Plus. An original story, the anime is set for a release in 2027, with Hideo Kojima serving as executive producer while Takayuki Sano will direct.

Related topics

item.title: There's a new Overwatch game in development
item.content:encoded:
Blizzard has announced a new mobile Overwatch game called Overwatch Rush. It's a top-down reinterpretation of the hero shooter built especially for mobile players and it's in development at Blizzard, made by a team separate from the Overwatch team, Blizzard said in a blog post.

A four-minute video of the game was shared with the announcement, showing a match in action, and it's immediately apparent from it how much slower the experience is. Characters move more slowly and aiming requirements are much less strenuous on two axes rather than three. Flying still exists, just, although the impact of verticality seems significantly reduced.

Despite the MOBA-like presentation and slow gameplay speed, the essence of a hectic Overwatch team fight is still there. We see iconic original Overwatch characters such as Reinhardt, Lucio, Mercy, Reaper and Tracer fight in a battle of a very familiar shape - Reinhardt shielding, Reaper and Tracer flanking, Lucio and Mercy healing. However, some abilities have been modified to fit the new format.

Blizzard described the game's development as being "early days" still, and the only indication of a release date was word it was preparing to test Overwatch Rush in "select countries". Joining the Overwatch Discord is how to stay abreast of when test phases will launch, apparently.

It's an interesting decision to separate this announcement from the Overwatch Spotlight event at the beginning of the month, where Blizzard showcased a new expansion for the game - and a new yearly expansion plan - which has since been released and reinvigorated the game. Perhaps associations with a mobile game risked jeopardising goodwill generated by that.

Nevertheless, Overwatch is currently in a good place. As I wrote last week, this is the most excited I've been about Overwatch in 10 years.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/theres-a-new-overwatch-game-in-development

item.title: The Super Mario Galaxy Movie may still have an unannounced character popping up on its release
item.content:encoded:
The Super Mario Galaxy Movie is only a matter of months from release, and it now seems an unannounced character may play a key role in the upcoming sequel thanks to a slight slip up by one UK cinema chain.

Please be aware of potential The Super Mario Galaxy Movie spoilers below.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

As spotted by IGN, luxury cinema chain Everyman recently released a description for The Super Mario Galaxy Movie, which read thus:

"After defeating Bowser and saving Brooklyn, Mario faces Wario and Bowser Jr.'s evil alliance. Now, alongside his friends and Yoshi, he must stop their plans for world domination."

Yep, that's Wario's name you read there, Nintendo's zig-zag moustachioed and purple dungareed wearing Mario-like caricature of a man, who is instantly recognisable by his bellicose cackle.

Since IGN spotted the cinema listing pointing to Wario's inclusion in the forthcoming film, Everyman has now changed its wording, and there is no mention of Nintendo's antihero. But, who could play Wario if he does indeed show up in The Super Mario Galaxy Movie, which is set to debut this April? I guess time will tellâ€¦

Along with Mario, Luigi and - perhaps - Wario, the upcoming animated sequel will also see Bowser Junior and Rosalina joining the chaos. Rosalina is being voiced by long-time Nintendo fan, Brie Larson.

Earlier this year, we were treated to a new trailer, which was introduced by Nintendo's Shigeru Miyamoto. This trailer saw Mario and Luigi pull up to investigate a "troubled pipe", while also offering us our first look at Yoshi and Birdo.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/the-super-mario-galaxy-movie-may-still-have-an-unannounced-character-popping-up-on-its-release
